User-Agent:       Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 6.1; WOW64; rv:2.0) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/4.0
Build Identifier: Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 6.1; WOW64; rv:2.0) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/4.0

It seems when I have Hardware Acceleration (will abbr. to HWA) enabled in Firefox 4RC, after a period of time (usually after about an hour), I get what I believe is a videocard resource problem, when for example the screen goes into sleep, and I bring it out, without HWA normally it will instantly come back on within a second...if I've been playing flash games etc. with HWA enabled, it will take from 5-10 seconds to bring the screens back on from sleep...as if it were trying to flush resources or clearing video memory.  This happens also if I shutdown the computer or put it to sleep, there is a noticeable delay (I use SSD HD so it's usually instantly off), this delay also freezes the mouse etc. during the recovery from sleep. None of this happens if I use Firefox 4RC without HWA and I can use Firefox 4RC all day as normal.

Seems whenever the screen "blank" for any reason they are vastly delayed by whatever HWA is doing in Firefox, even when FF is closed the problem is there till you reboot.  I used Google Chrome as a test all yesterday and I never had the problem of delay.

Reproducible: Always

Steps to Reproduce:
1.  Enable Hardware Acceleration in Firefox 4RC
2.  Do anything that uses Hardware Acceleration (flash games etc.  I tested using flash games in FaceBook) usually for about 1 hour or so)
3.  Try to do CTRL+ALT_DEL to activate Task Manager, this is usually instant, but when the problem is there it takes 5-10 seconds to get there.
Actual Results:  
5-10 second delay for anything that requires the screen to switch or change, mouse will freeze during this period of time.

Expected Results:  
None of the above! :)

Hardware used...
AMD Phenom II X4 965
8GB DDR2
SATA SSD C300 64GB Crucial HD
SATA secondard standard HD
Microsoft Mouse
Video : Asus HD5850 1GB (Code : RV870)

In Firefox, standard theme etc.
